definitions.definition: A body of words, and set of methods of combining them (called a grammar), understood by a community and used as a form of communication.
definitions.example: Deaf and mute people communicate using languages like ASL.

definitions.definition: The ability to communicate using words.
A sublanguage: the slang of a particular community or jargon of a particular specialist field.
definitions.example: legal language;   the language of chemistry

definitions.definition: The expression of thought (the communication of meaning) in a specified way; that which communicates something, as language does.
definitions.example: body language;   the language of the eyes

definitions.definition: A body of sounds, signs and/or signals by which animals communicate, and by which plants are sometimes also thought to communicate.
A computer language; a machine language.
The particular words used in a speech or a passage of text.
definitions.example: The language he used to talk to me was obscene.

definitions.definition: To communicate by language; to express in language.
A languet, a flat plate in or below the flue pipe of an organ.
